title: 107_hr3853
content:
Section 1 amends the Lackawanna Valley National Heritage Area Act to allow the management entity to make grants, enter agreements, and hire staff for the management plan. Section 2 corrects spelling errors in the Hawaii National Park Act. Section 3 addresses the "I Have a Dream" plaque at the Lincoln Memorial. SEC. 3 amends Public Law 106-365 by correcting a word and SEC. 4 pertains to wild and scenic rivers and national trails. (a) Amendments to the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act include redesignating paragraphs for various rivers in Delaware, Pennsylvania, Florida, and Oregon. (b) Changes to the National Trails System Act are also made. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to redesignate paragraphs for rivers in different states, while the National Trails System Act is also modified. Additionally, the Act is amended to redesignate paragraphs related to the Ala Kahakai National Historic Trail and adjust the margins accordingly. The Jamestown 400th Commemoration Commission Act of 2000 is amended to change references from "State" to "Commonwealth" in various sections and to redefine the term "Commonwealth" to include Virginia agencies. Additionally, a numerical change is made in section 4(b)(1). The Rosie the Riveter/World War II Home Front National Historical Park Establishment Act of 2000 is amended to update various sections, including changing references to specific locations and facilities related to World War II. The Rosie the Riveter/World War II Home Front National Historical Park Establishment Act of 2000 is amended to update locations and facilities related to World War II, including the Child Development Field Centers, Atchison Housing, Kaiser-Permanente Field Hospital, and Richmond Fire Station 67A. The Vicksburg Campaign Trail Battlefields Preservation Act of 2000 is amended to include Kentucky in addition to Tennessee. Fort Heiman in Calloway County and resources in and around Columbus in Hickman County, Kentucky are now part of the preservation efforts. SEC. 8. HARRIET TUBMAN SPECIAL RESOURCE STUDY. Amends the Harriet Tubman Special Resource Study Act by updating references to the National Park System General Authorities Act.

SEC. 9. PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCY FOUNDATIONS. Allows employees of foundations established by Congress to solicit funds for Federal land management agencies to qualify for General Service Administration contract airfares.

SEC. 10. PERSONAL WATERCRAFT TIME EXTENSION. Extends the grace period for personal watercraft use in certain National Park System units until December 31, 2004.

SEC. 11. POPULAR NAMES. SEC. 11. POPULAR NAMES. Amends the National Park Service Organic Act and the National Park System General Authorities Act to include specific citations for popular names. SEC. 12. PARK POLICE INDEMNIFICATION. Amends a previous Act by adjusting language regarding park police indemnification.
